ai-an2:1.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-an2:1.2.3_0: The fault apparent in the present life, and the fault to do with lives to come.
ai-an2:1.2.4_0: What is the fault apparent in the present life?
ai-an2:1.2.5_0: It’s when someone sees that kings have arrested a bandit, a criminal, and subjected them to various punishments—
ai-an2:1.2.6_0: whipping, caning, and clubbing; cutting off hands or feet, or both; cutting off ears or nose, or both; the ‘porridge pot’, the ‘shell-shave’, the ‘demon’s mouth’, the ‘garland of fire’, the ‘burning hand’, the ‘grass blades’, the ‘bark dress’, the ‘antelope’, the ‘meat hook’, the ‘coins’, the ‘caustic pickle’, the ‘twisting bar’, the ‘straw mat’; being splashed with hot oil, being fed to the dogs, being impaled alive, and being beheaded.
ai-an2:1.3.2_0: ‘The kinds of deeds for which the kings inflict such punishments—
ai-an2:1.3.3_0: whipping, caning, and clubbing; cutting off hands or feet, or both; cutting off ears or nose, or both; the ‘porridge pot’, the ‘shell-shave’, the ‘demon’s mouth’, the ‘garland of fire’, the ‘burning hand’, the ‘grass blades’, the ‘bark dress’, the ‘antelope’, the ‘meat hook’, the ‘coins’, the ‘caustic pickle’, the ‘twisting bar’, the ‘straw mat’; being splashed with hot oil, being fed to the dogs, being impaled alive, and being beheaded.
ai-an2:1.3.4_0: the rulers would arrest me and subject me to the same punishments.
ai-an2:1.3.5_0: were to cut off my heads and nose cut off.’
ai-an2:1.3.6_0: Afraid of the fault apparent in the present life, they do not steal the belongings of others.
ai-an2:1.3.7_0: This is called the fault apparent in the present life.
ai-an2:1.4.1_0: What is the fault to do with lives to come?
ai-an2:1.4.3_0: ‘Bad conduct of body, speech, or mind has a bad, painful result in the next life.
ai-an2:1.4.5_0: then, when my body breaks up, after death, won’t I be reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell?’
ai-an2:1.4.6_0: Afraid of the fault to do with lives to come, they give up bad conduct by way of body, speech, and mind, and develop good conduct by way of body, speech, and mind, keeping themselves pure.
ai-an2:1.4.7_0: This is called the fault to do with lives to come.
ai-an2:1.4.9_0: So you should train like this:
ai-an2:1.4.10_0: ‘We will fear the fault apparent in the present life, and we will fear the fault to do with lives to come. We will fear faults, seeing the danger in faults.’
ai-an2:1.4.12_0: If you fear faults, seeing the danger in faults, you can expect to be freed from all faults.”
ai-an2:2.1.1_0: “These two endeavors are challenging in the world.
ai-an2:2.1.3_0: The endeavor of laypeople staying in a home to provide robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick. And the endeavor of those gone forth from the lay life to homelessness to let go of all attachments.
ai-an2:2.1.4_0: These are the two endeavors that make an effort in the world.
ai-an2:2.2.1_0: The better of these two endeavors is the effort to let go of all attachments.
ai-an2:2.2.2_0: So you should train like this:
ai-an2:2.2.3_0: ‘We shall endeavor to let go of all attachments.’
ai-an2:3.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:3.1.3_0: It’s when someone has done bad things and not done good things, by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an2:3.1.4_0: it is done by way of body, speech, and mind,
ai-an2:3.1.5_0: it is done by way of body, speech, and mind, and what is not done.
ai-an2:3.1.6_0: Thinking, ‘I’ve done bad things by way of body, speech, and mind’, they’re mortified. Thinking, ‘I haven’t done good things by way of body, speech, and mind’, they’re mortified.
ai-an2:3.1.7_0: Thinking, ‘I’ve done bad things by way of body, speech, and mind’, they’re mortified. Thinking, ‘I haven’t done good things by way of body, speech, and mind’, they’re mortified.
ai-an2:3.1.8_0: ‘I’ve done bad things by way of body, speech, and mind’, they’re mortified. Thinking, ‘I haven’t done good things by way of body, speech, and mind’, they’re mortified.
ai-an2:3.1.9_0: These are the two things that are mortifying.”
ai-an2:4.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:4.1.3_0: It’s when someone has done good things and not done bad things, by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an2:4.1.4_0: it is done by way of body, speech, and mind,
ai-an2:4.1.5_0: done by way of mind, it is done by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an2:4.1.6_0: Thinking, ‘I’ve done good things by way of body, speech, and mind’, they’re not mortified. Thinking, ‘I haven’t done bad things by way of body, speech, and mind’, they’re not mortified.
ai-an2:4.1.7_0: Thinking, ‘I’ve done good things by way of body, speech, and mind’, they’re not mortified.
ai-an2:4.1.8_0: Thinking: ‘I’ve done good things by way of body, speech, and mind’, they’re not mortified.
ai-an2:4.1.9_0: These are the two things that are unmortifying.”
ai-an2:5.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I have learned these two things for myself—
ai-an2:5.1.2_0: to never be content with skillful qualities, and to never stop trying.
ai-an2:5.1.4_0: ‘Gladly, let my skin, sinews, and bones remain! Let the flesh and blood waste away in my body! I will not stop trying until I have achieved what is possible by human strength, energy, and vigor.’
ai-an2:5.1.5_0: It was by diligence that I achieved awakening, and by diligence that I achieved the supreme sanctuary.
ai-an2:5.1.6_0: If you too never stop trying, thinking:
ai-an2:5.1.7_0: ‘Gladly, let my skin, sinews, and bones remain! Let the flesh and blood waste away in my body! I will not stop trying until I have achieved what is possible by human strength, energy, and vigor.’
ai-an2:5.1.8_0: You will soon realize the supreme culmination of the spiritual path in this very life. You will live having achieved with your own insight the goal for which gentlemen rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.
ai-an2:5.1.9_0: So you should train like this:
ai-an2:5.1.11_0: “Gladly, let only skin, sinews, and bones remain! Let the flesh and blood waste away in my body! I will not stop trying until I have achieved what is possible by human strength, energy, and vigor.”’
ai-an2:6.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:6.1.3_0: Rather, the gratification in things that are prone to being fettered, and the gratification provided by these things.
ai-an2:6.1.4_0: When you keep seeing things that are prone to being fettered as boring, you don’t give up greed, hate, and delusion.
ai-an2:6.1.5_0: When these are not given up, you’re not freed from rebirth, old age, and death, from sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress.
ai-an2:6.1.6_0: They’re not freed from suffering, I say.
ai-an2:6.2.1_0: When you keep seeing things that are prone to being fettered as boring, you give up greed, hate, and delusion.
ai-an2:6.2.2_0: When these are given up, you’re freed from rebirth, old age, and death, from sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress.
ai-an2:6.2.3_0: They’re freed from suffering, I say.
ai-an2:6.2.5_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an2:7.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:7.1.4_0: These are the two things that are dark.”
ai-an2:8.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:8.1.4_0: These are the two things that are bright.”
ai-an2:9.1.1_0: “These two things, mendicants, protect the world.
ai-an2:9.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:9.1.4_0: If these two bright things did not protect the world, there would be no recognition of the status of mother, aunts, or wives and partners of teachers and respected people.
ai-an2:9.1.5_0: The world would become promiscuous, like goats and sheep, chickens and pigs, and dogs and jackals.
ai-an2:9.1.6_0: But because the two bright things protect the world, there is recognition of the status of mother, aunts, and wives and partners of teachers and respected people.”
ai-an2:10.1.1_0: “There are two entries to the rainy-season residence.
ai-an2:10.1.4_0: These are the two rains residences.”
ai-an2:10.1.6_0: The first sub-chapter on legal procedures is finished.
ai-an2:10.2.1_0: Two Vajjians, likewise, have the two endeavors.
ai-an2:10.2.2_0: with a knower of the fifth,
ai-an2:10.2.4_0: bright temperaments of the rainy-season residence, like graceful.
ai-an2:11.1.3_0: The power of reflection and the power of development.
ai-an2:11.1.4_0: And what is the power of reflection?
ai-an2:11.1.6_0: ‘Bad conduct of body, speech, or mind has a bad, painful result in both this life and the next.’
ai-an2:11.1.7_0: Reflecting like this, they give up bad conduct by way of body, speech, and mind, and develop good conduct by way of body, speech, and mind, keeping themselves pure.
ai-an2:11.1.8_0: This is called the power of reflection.
ai-an2:11.2.1_0: And what, mendicants, is the power of development?
ai-an2:11.2.2_0: In this context, the power of development is the power of the trainees.
ai-an2:11.2.3_0: For when you rely on the power of a trainee, you give up greed, hate, and delusion.
ai-an2:11.2.4_0: Then you don’t do anything unskillful, or practice anything bad.
ai-an2:11.2.5_0: This is called the power of development.
ai-an2:12.1.3_0: The power of reflection and the power of development.
ai-an2:12.1.4_0: And what is the power of reflection?
ai-an2:12.1.6_0: ‘Bad conduct of body, speech, or mind has a bad, painful result in both this life and the next.’
ai-an2:12.1.7_0: Reflecting like this, they give up bad conduct by way of body, speech, and mind, and develop good conduct by way of body, speech, and mind, keeping themselves pure.
ai-an2:12.1.8_0: This is called the power of reflection.
ai-an2:12.2.1_0: And what, mendicants, is the power of development?
ai-an2:12.2.2_0: It’s when a mendicant develops the awakening factors of mindfulness,
ai-an2:12.2.8_0: and equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.
ai-an2:12.2.9_0: This is called the power of development.
ai-an2:13.1.3_0: The power of reflection and the power of development.
ai-an2:13.1.4_0: And what is the power of reflection?
ai-an2:13.1.6_0: ‘Bad conduct of body, speech, or mind has a bad, painful result in both this life and the next.’
ai-an2:13.1.7_0: Reflecting like this, they give up bad conduct by way of body, speech, and mind, and develop good conduct by way of body, speech, and mind, keeping themselves pure.
ai-an2:13.1.8_0: This is called the power of reflection.
ai-an2:13.2.1_0: And what, mendicants, is the power of development?
ai-an2:13.2.2_0: Now, take a mendicant who, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected.
ai-an2:13.2.3_0: As the placing of the mind and keeping it connected are stilled, they enter and remain in the second absorption ...
ai-an2:13.2.4_0: And with the fading away of rapture, they enter and remain in the third absorption, where they meditate with equanimity, mindful and aware, personally experiencing the bliss of which the noble ones declare, ‘Equanimous and mindful, one meditates in bliss.’
ai-an2:13.2.4_1: ‘One is even-minded, mindful, and abides in bliss.’
ai-an2:13.2.5_0: Giving up pleasure and pain, and ending former happiness and sadness, they enter and remain in the fourth absorption, without pleasure or pain, with pure equanimity and mindfulness.
ai-an2:13.2.6_0: This is called the power of development.
ai-an2:14.1.1_0: “There are, mendicants, these two ways of teaching the Dhamma.
ai-an2:14.1.4_0: These are the two ways of teaching the Dhamma.”
ai-an2:15.1.1_0: “Mendicants, in a disciplinary issue, if neither the offending mendicant nor the accusing mendicant carefully checks themselves, you can expect that issue
ai-an2:15.1.2_0: long, fractious, and troublesome, and the mendicants won’t live comfortably.
ai-an2:15.1.3_0: But in a disciplinary issue, if both the offending mendicant and the accusing mendicant carefully check themselves, you can expect that issue
ai-an2:15.1.4_0: won’t lead to lasting acrimony and enmity, and the mendicants will live comfortably.
ai-an2:15.2.1_0: And how, mendicants, does an offending mendicant carefully check themselves?
ai-an2:15.2.3_0: ‘I’ve committed a certain unskillful offense with the body.
ai-an2:15.2.4_0: Then they saw me with the unskillful currents,
ai-an2:15.2.5_0: If I hadn’t committed that offense, they wouldn’t have seen them.
ai-an2:15.2.6_0: But since I did commit that offense, they did see me.
ai-an2:15.2.7_0: When they saw me, they were upset,
ai-an2:15.2.8_0: and they voiced their unhappiness to me.
ai-an2:15.2.11_0: So the mistake is mine alone, like someone who owes customs duty on their goods.’
ai-an2:15.2.12_0: That’s how, mendicants, an offending mendicant carefully checks themselves.
ai-an2:15.3.1_0: And how, mendicants, does an accusing mendicant carefully check themselves?
ai-an2:15.3.3_0: ‘This mendicant has committed a certain unskillful offense with the body.
ai-an2:15.3.5_0: If they hadn’t committed that offense, I wouldn’t have seen them.
ai-an2:15.3.6_0: But since they did commit that offense, I did see them.
ai-an2:15.3.7_0: When I saw them, I was upset,
ai-an2:15.3.8_0: and I voiced my unhappiness to them.
ai-an2:15.3.11_0: So the mistake is mine alone, like someone who owes customs duty on their goods.’
ai-an2:15.3.12_0: That’s how, mendicants, an accusing mendicant carefully checks themselves.
ai-an2:15.4.1_0: In a disciplinary issue, if neither the offending mendicant nor the accusing mendicant carefully checks themselves, you can expect that issue will lead to lasting acrimony and enmity, and the mendicants won’t live comfortably.
ai-an2:15.4.2_0: But in a disciplinary issue, if both the offending mendicant and the accusing mendicant carefully checks themselves, you can expect that issue won’t lead to lasting acrimony and enmity, and the mendicants will live comfortably.”
ai-an2:16.1.1_0: Then a certain brahmin went up to the Buddha and exchanged greetings with him.
ai-an2:16.1.2_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-an2:16.1.2_1: While sat on one side that brahmin said this to the Fortunate One:
ai-an2:16.1.3_0: “What is the cause, Master Gotama, what is the reason why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell?”
ai-an2:16.1.4_0: “Unprincipled and immoral conduct is the reason why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.”
ai-an2:16.2.1_0: “What is the cause, Master Gotama, what is the reason why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm?”
ai-an2:16.2.2_0: “Principled and moral conduct is the reason why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.”
ai-an2:16.3.2_0: Just as one might set upright what had been overturned, or reveal what had been hidden, or show the way to one who was lost, or bring a lamp into the darkness so that
ai-an2:16.3.2_1: so that one with eyes might see what’s there—
ai-an2:16.3.2_2: just so has the Dhamma been explained by the dear Gotama in countless ways.
ai-an2:16.3.3_0: Good Gotama, I go for refuge to you, and to the Teaching and to the Sangha of monks.
ai-an2:16.3.4_0: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
ai-an2:17.1.1_0: Then the brahmin Jāṇussoṇi went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.
ai-an2:17.1.2_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-an2:17.1.3_0: “What is the cause, Master Gotama, what is the reason why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell?”
ai-an2:17.1.5_0: That’s why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.”
ai-an2:17.1.6_0: “But what is the cause, Master Gotama, what is the reason why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm?”
ai-an2:17.1.8_0: That’s why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.”
ai-an2:17.1.9_0: “I don’t understand the detailed meaning of what Master Gotama has said in brief, without explaining the details.
ai-an2:17.1.10_0: Master Gotama, please teach me this matter in detail so I can understand the meaning.”
ai-an2:17.1.11_0: “Well then, brahmin, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-an2:17.2.1_0: “Brahmin, it’s when someone has done bad things and not done good things, by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an2:17.2.2_0: it is done by way of body, speech, and mind,
ai-an2:17.2.3_0: it is done by way of body, speech, and mind, and what is not done.
ai-an2:17.2.4_0: So what they’ve done and what they’ve not done is why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-an2:17.2.5_0: Furthermore, brahmin, someone has done good things and not done bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an2:17.2.6_0: it is done by way of body, speech, and mind,
ai-an2:17.2.7_0: done by way of mind, it is done by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an2:17.2.8_0: So what they’ve done and what they’ve not done is why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.”
ai-an2:17.3.1_1: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
ai-an2:18.1.1_0: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha,
ai-an2:18.1.2_0: “Ānanda, I absolutely say that you should not do bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.”
ai-an2:18.1.3_0: “But, sir, if someone does these things that should not be done, what drawbacks should they expect?”
ai-an2:18.1.6_0: After examination, sensible people criticize you.
ai-an2:18.1.8_0: They feel lost when they die.
ai-an2:18.1.9_0: And when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-an2:18.1.10_0: These are the drawbacks they should expect.”
ai-an2:18.2.1_0: “Ānanda, I absolutely say that you should do good things by way of body, speech, and mind.”
ai-an2:18.2.2_0: “But, sir, if someone does these things that should be done, what benefits should they expect?”
ai-an2:18.2.5_0: After examination, sensible people praise you.
ai-an2:18.2.8_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
ai-an2:18.2.9_0: These are the benefits they should expect.”
ai-an2:19.1.2_0: It is possible to give up the unskillful.
ai-an2:19.1.3_0: If it wasn’t possible, I wouldn’t say:
ai-an2:19.1.5_0: But it is possible, and so I say:
ai-an2:19.1.7_0: And if giving up the unskillful led to harm and suffering, I would not say:
ai-an2:19.1.9_0: But giving up the unskillful leads to welfare and happiness, so I say:
ai-an2:19.2.2_0: It is possible to develop the skillful.
ai-an2:19.2.3_0: If it wasn’t possible, I wouldn’t say:
ai-an2:19.2.5_0: But since it is possible, I say:
ai-an2:19.2.7_0: And if someone were to say:
ai-an2:19.2.9_0: But developing the skillful leads to welfare and happiness, so I say:
ai-an2:20.1.1_0: “These two things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.
ai-an2:20.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:20.1.3_0: The meaning is that words and phrases.
ai-an2:20.1.4_0: The meaning is improperly interpreted with improper words and phrases.
ai-an2:20.1.5_0: These two things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.
ai-an2:20.2.1_0: These two things lead to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.
ai-an2:20.2.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:20.2.3_0: The words and phrases are well organized, and the meaning is correctly interpreted.
ai-an2:20.2.4_0: When the words and phrases are well organized, the meaning is correctly interpreted.
ai-an2:20.2.5_0: These two things lead to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.”
ai-an2:20.2.6_0: The second sub-chapter on legal issues is finished.
ai-an2:21.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:21.1.3_0: One who doesn’t recognize when they’ve made a mistake. And one who doesn’t properly accept the confession of someone who’s made a mistake.
ai-an2:21.2.1_0: There are these two who are astute.
ai-an2:21.2.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:21.2.3_0: One who recognizes when they’ve made a mistake. And one who properly accepts the confession of someone who’s made a mistake.
ai-an2:21.2.4_0: These are the two who are astute.”
ai-an2:22.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these two misrepresent the Realized One.
ai-an2:22.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:22.1.3_0: One who is hateful and hides it, and one whose faith is mistaken.
ai-an2:22.1.4_0: These two misrepresent the Realized One.”
ai-an2:23.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these two misrepresent the Realized One.
ai-an2:23.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:23.1.3_0: One who explains what was not spoken by the Realized One as spoken by him. And one who explains what was spoken by the Realized One as not spoken by him.
ai-an2:23.1.4_0: These two misrepresent the Realized One.
ai-an2:23.2.1_0: These two don’t misrepresent the Realized One.
ai-an2:23.2.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:23.2.3_0: One who explains what was not spoken by the Realized One as not spoken by him. And one who explains what was spoken by the Realized One as spoken by him.
ai-an2:23.2.4_0: These two don’t misrepresent the Realized One.”
ai-an2:24.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these two misrepresent the Realized One.
ai-an2:24.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:24.1.3_0: One who explains a discourse in need of interpretation as a discourse whose meaning is explicit. And one who explains a discourse whose meaning is explicit as a discourse whose meaning is explicit.
ai-an2:24.1.4_0: These two misrepresent the Realized One.”
ai-an2:25.1.1_0: “These two don’t misrepresent the Realized One.
ai-an2:25.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:25.1.3_0: One who explains a discourse in need of interpretation as a discourse whose meaning is explicit. And one who explains a discourse whose meaning is explicit as a discourse whose meaning is explicit.
ai-an2:25.1.4_0: These two don’t misrepresent the Realized One.”
ai-an2:26.1.1_0: “Mendicants, you can expect one of two destinies:
ai-an2:26.2.1_0: When you don’t hide your misdeeds, you can expect one of two destinies:
ai-an2:26.2.2_0: as a god or a human.”
ai-an2:27.1.1_0: “Mendicants, when you have wrong view, you can expect one of two destinies:
ai-an2:28.1.1_0: “Mendicants, when you have right view, you can expect one of two destinies:
ai-an2:28.1.2_0: as a god or a human.”
ai-an2:29.1.1_0: “There are two places waiting to receive an unethical person:
ai-an2:29.2.1_0: There are two places waiting to receive an ethical person:
ai-an2:29.2.2_0: as a god or a human.”
ai-an2:30.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I see two reasons to frequent remote lodgings in the wilderness and the forest.
ai-an2:30.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:30.1.3_0: I see a happy life for myself in the present. And I have compassion for future generations, thinking:
ai-an2:30.1.4_0: Seeing these two reasons I frequent remote lodgings in the wilderness and the forest.”
ai-an2:31.1.1_0: “There are two things that play a part in realization.
ai-an2:31.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:31.1.4_0: What is the benefit of developing serenity?
ai-an2:31.1.6_0: What is the benefit of developing the mind?
ai-an2:31.1.8_0: What is the benefit of developing discernment?
ai-an2:31.1.10_0: What is the benefit of developing wisdom?
ai-an2:31.1.12_0: The mind contaminated by greed is not free; and wisdom contaminated by ignorance does not grow.
ai-an2:31.1.13_0: In this way, freedom of heart comes from the fading away of greed, while freedom by wisdom comes from the fading away of ignorance.”
ai-an2:31.1.14_0: The third sub-chapter on fools is finished.
ai-an2:32.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I will teach you the level of the bad person and the level of the good person.
ai-an2:32.1.2_0: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-an2:32.2.1_0: “What is the level of the bad person?
ai-an2:32.2.2_0: The bad person is ungrateful and thankless,
ai-an2:32.2.3_0: for the wicked only know how to be ungrateful and thankless.
ai-an2:32.2.4_0: It is totally the level of a bad person to be ungrateful and thankless.
ai-an2:32.2.5_0: The good person is grateful and thankful,
ai-an2:32.2.6_0: for the virtuous only know how to be grateful and thankful.
ai-an2:32.2.7_0: It is totally the level of a good person to be grateful and thankful.”
ai-an2:33.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I say that two things is not easy.
ai-an2:33.1.4_0: You would not have done enough to repay your mother and father even if you were to carry your mother around on one shoulder, and your father on the other, and if you lived like this for a hundred years, and if you were to anoint, massage, bathe, and rub them;
ai-an2:33.1.5_0: If they were to sun their mother and father then would still be done so that
ai-an2:33.1.6_0: Even if you were to establish your mother and father as supreme monarchs of this great earth, abounding in the seven treasures, you would still not have done enough to repay them.
ai-an2:33.1.8_0: Parents are very helpful to their children, they raise them, nurture them, and show them the world.
ai-an2:33.1.9_0: But you have done enough, more than enough, to repay them if you encourage, settle, and ground unfaithful parents in faith, unethical parents in ethical conduct, stingy parents in generosity, or ignorant parents in wisdom.”
ai-an2:34.1.1_0: Then a certain brahmin went up to the Buddha.
ai-an2:34.1.1_2: And how should they do this?
ai-an2:34.1.1_3: While sat on one side that brahmin said this to the Fortunate One:
ai-an2:34.1.2_0: “What does Master Gotama teach? What does he explain?”
ai-an2:34.1.4_0: “But in what way does Master Gotama teach action and inaction?”
ai-an2:34.2.1_0: “I teach inaction regarding bad bodily, verbal, and mental conduct, and the many kinds of unskillful things.
ai-an2:34.2.2_0: I teach action regarding good bodily, verbal, and mental conduct, and the many kinds of skillful things.
ai-an2:34.2.3_0: This is the kind of action and inaction that I teach.”
ai-an2:34.3.1_1: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
ai-an2:35.1.1_0: Then he went to the Buddha,
ai-an2:35.1.1_2: While sitting on one side the householder Anāthapiṇḍika said this to the Fortunate One:
ai-an2:35.1.2_0: “How many kinds of people in the world are worthy of a religious donation? And where should a gift be given?”
ai-an2:35.1.3_0: “Householder, there are two kinds of people in the world who are worthy of a religious donation:
ai-an2:35.1.5_0: These are the two offerings in the world that’s given, one should be given to the donor.”
ai-an2:35.2.1_0: That is what the Buddha said.
ai-an2:35.2.2_0: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
ai-an2:35.3.2_0: are worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods.
ai-an2:35.3.5_0: This is the field for sponsors of sacrifice—
ai-an2:35.3.6_0: what’s given here is very fruitful.”
ai-an2:36.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-an2:36.1.3_0: Now at that time Venerable Sāriputta was staying near Sāvatthī in the Eastern Monastery, the stilt longhouse of Migāra’s mother.
ai-an2:36.1.8_0: “I will teach you about a person fettered internally and one fettered externally.
ai-an2:36.1.9_0: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-an2:36.2.2_0: First, a mendicant is ethical, restrained in the monastic code, conducting themselves well and seeking alms in suitable places. Seeing danger in the slightest fault, they keep the rules they’ve undertaken.
ai-an2:36.2.3_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in one of the orders of gods.
ai-an2:36.2.4_0: When they pass away from there, they’re a returner, not coming back to this state of existence.
ai-an2:36.2.5_0: This is called a person who is fettered internally, a returner, who comes back to this state of existence.
ai-an2:36.3.1_0: And who is the person fetter externally?
ai-an2:36.3.2_0: First, a mendicant is ethical, restrained in the monastic code, conducting themselves well and seeking alms in suitable places. Seeing danger in the slightest fault, they keep the rules they’ve undertaken.
ai-an2:36.3.3_0: They enter and remain in a certain peaceful state of freed mind.
ai-an2:36.3.4_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in one of the orders of gods.
ai-an2:36.3.5_0: When they pass away from there, they’re a non-returner, not coming back to this state of existence.
ai-an2:36.3.6_0: This is called a person who is fettered externally, a non-returner, who does not come back to this state of existence.
ai-an2:36.4.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is ethical ... they keep the rules they’ve undertaken.
ai-an2:36.4.2_0: They simply practice for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding sensual pleasures.
ai-an2:36.4.3_0: They simply practice for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding future lives.
ai-an2:36.4.4_0: They practice for the ending of craving.
ai-an2:36.4.5_0: They practice for the ending of greed.
ai-an2:36.4.6_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in one of the orders of gods.
ai-an2:36.4.7_0: When they pass away from there, they’re a non-returner, not coming back to this state of existence.
ai-an2:36.4.8_0: This is called a person who is fettered externally, a non-returner, who does not come back to this state of existence.”
ai-an2:36.5.1_0: Then several peaceful-minded deities went to the Fortunate One,
ai-an2:36.5.1_2: While standing on one side those gods said this to the Fortunate One:
ai-an2:36.5.2_0: “Sir, Venerable Sāriputta is in the Eastern Monastery, the stilt longhouse of Migāra’s mother, where he is teaching the mendicants about a person with internal fetters and one with external fetters.
ai-an2:36.5.4_0: Sir, please go to Venerable Sāriputta out of compassion.”
ai-an2:36.5.5_0: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.
ai-an2:36.5.6_0: Then the Buddha, as easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm, vanished from the bank of the river Vaggumudā, and reappeared in the presence of the Buddha.
ai-an2:36.5.6_1: In the same way, too, the Buddha disappeared in front of Sāriputta and appeared in front of Sāriputta.
ai-an2:36.5.7_0: He sat on the seat spread out
ai-an2:36.5.8_0: Sāriputta bowed to the Buddha and sat down to one side.
ai-an2:36.6.1_0: “Sāriputta, severals, who have a minds approached me,
ai-an2:36.6.1_1: and after approaching and worshipping me, they stood on one side.
ai-an2:36.6.2_0: ‘Sir, Venerable Sāriputta is in the Eastern Monastery, the stilt longhouse of Migāra’s mother, where he is teaching the mendicants about a person with internal fetters and one with external fetters.
ai-an2:36.6.4_0: Sir, please go to Venerable Sāriputta out of compassion.’
ai-an2:36.6.5_0: Those deities, though they number ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, or sixty, can stand on the point of a needle without bumping up against each other.
ai-an2:36.6.7_0: ‘Surely those deities, since so many of them can stand on the point of a needle without bumping up against each other, must have developed their minds in that place.’
ai-an2:36.6.8_0: But you should not see it like this.
ai-an2:36.6.9_0: It was right here that those deities developed their minds.
ai-an2:36.6.9_1: but they don’t disturb each other.
ai-an2:36.6.10_0: So you should train like this:
ai-an2:36.6.11_0: ‘We shall have peaceful faculties and peaceful minds.’
ai-an2:36.6.13_0: When your faculties and mind are peaceful, your acts of body, speech, and mind will be peaceful, thinking:
ai-an2:36.6.14_0: Upacālā, Upacālā, who will live peacefully.’
ai-an2:36.6.16_0: Those wanderers who follow other paths, Sāriputta, who have not heard this exposition of the teaching are lost.”
ai-an2:37.1.2_0: At one time Venerable Mahākaccāna was staying at Varaṇā, on the bank of the Kaddama Lake.
ai-an2:37.1.3_0: Then the brahmin Mahākaccāna approached Mahākaccāna,
ai-an2:37.1.3_1: and after going, he exchanged greetings with him.
ai-an2:37.1.4_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-an2:37.1.4_1: He bowed, sat down to one side, and said to Mahākaccāna:
ai-an2:37.1.5_0: “What is the cause, Master Kaccāna, what is the reason why aristocrats fight with aristocrats, brahmins fight with brahmins, and householders fight with householders?”
ai-an2:37.1.6_0: “It is because of their insistence on sensual desire, their shackles, avarice, and attachment, that aristocrats fight with aristocrats, brahmins fight with brahmins, and householders fight with householders.”
ai-an2:37.2.1_0: “But what’s the cause, Master Kaccāna, what’s the reason why the ascetic Kaccāna are these things?”
ai-an2:37.2.2_0: “Someone who has adhered to greed, looking for views that cannot be shackled by ascetics.”
ai-an2:37.3.1_0: “Master Kaccāna, is there anyone in the world who has gone beyond the insistence on sensual desire and the insistence on views?”
ai-an2:37.3.2_0: “Brahmin, there is a person in the world who has gone beyond the insistence on sensual desire and the insistence on views.”
ai-an2:37.4.1_0: “Who in the world has gone beyond the insistence on sensual desire and the insistence on views?”
ai-an2:37.4.2_0: “There is a city in the eastern countries a city by the name of Sāvatthī.
ai-an2:37.4.3_0: There that Blessed One is now staying, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.
ai-an2:37.4.4_0: He, brahmin, has gone beyond the insistence on sensual desire and the insistence on views.”
ai-an2:37.5.1_0: When this was said, the brahmin Ārāmadaṇḍa got up from his seat, arranged his robe over one shoulder, knelt on his right knee, raised his joined palms toward the Buddha, and expressed this heartfelt sentiment three times:
ai-an2:37.6.1_0: “Reverence to that Fortunate One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha
ai-an2:37.7.1_0: Reverence to him, the Fortunate One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha
ai-an2:37.8.1_0: Reverence to him, the Fortunate One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha
ai-an2:37.9.1_0: He who has gone beyond the insistence on sensual desire and the insistence on views.
ai-an2:37.10.2_0: Just as one might set upright what had been overturned, or reveal what was hidden, or show the way to one who was lost, or bring a path to the lost,
ai-an2:37.10.2_1: or bear an oil lamp in the darkness,
ai-an2:37.10.2_2: so that one with eyes might see what’s there—
ai-an2:37.10.2_3: just so has the Dhamma been explained by the dear Kaccāna in many ways.
ai-an2:37.10.3_0: I go for refuge to Master Gotama, to the teaching, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.
ai-an2:37.10.4_0: From this day forth, may Master Kaccāna remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
ai-an2:38.1.1_0: At one time Venerable Mahākaccāna was staying near Madhurā, in Gunda’s Grove.
ai-an2:38.1.2_0: Then the brahmin Kandarāyana went up to Mahākaccāna,
ai-an2:38.1.2_2: He bowed, sat down to one side, and said to Mahākaccāna:
ai-an2:38.1.3_0: “I have heard, Master Kaccāna, that the ascetic Kaccāna doesn’t bow to old brahmins, the elderly and senior, who are advanced in years and have reached the final stage of life; nor does he rise in their presence or offer them a seat.
ai-an2:38.1.4_0: And this is indeed the case,
ai-an2:38.1.5_0: for the ascetic Kaccāna does not bow to old brahmins, elderly and senior, who are advanced in years and have reached the final stage of life; nor does he rise in their presence or offer them a seat.
ai-an2:38.2.1_0: “There is the stage of an elder and the stage of youth as explained by the Blessed One, who knows and sees, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.
ai-an2:38.2.2_0: If an elder, though eighty, ninety, or a hundred years old, still dwells in the midst of sensual pleasures, enjoying them, consumed by thoughts of them, burning with fever for them, and eagerly seeking more,
ai-an2:38.2.3_0: they are reckoned as a child, not a senior.
ai-an2:38.2.4_0: If a youth, young, black-haired, blessed with youth, in the prime of life,
ai-an2:38.2.5_0: does not dwell in the midst of sensual pleasures, enjoying them, consumed by thoughts of them, burning with fever for them, and eagerly seeking more,
ai-an2:38.2.6_0: they are reckoned as astute, a senior.”
ai-an2:38.3.1_0: When he had spoken, the brahmin Kandarāyana got up from his seat, arranged his robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the mendicants, thinking:
ai-an2:38.3.2_0: “The masters are elders, at the stage of the elder;
ai-an2:38.3.3_0: we are youths, at the stage of youth.
ai-an2:38.4.1_1: From this day forth, may Master Kaccāna remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
ai-an2:39.1.1_0: “At a time when bandits are strong, kings are weak.
ai-an2:39.1.2_0: Then the king is not at ease when going out or coming back or when inspecting the provinces.
ai-an2:39.1.3_0: The brahmins and householders, likewise, are not at ease when going out or coming back, or when inspecting their business activities.
ai-an2:39.1.4_0: In the same way, at a time when bad mendicants are strong, good-hearted mendicants are weak.
ai-an2:39.1.5_0: Then the good-hearted mendicants continually adhere to silence in the midst of the Saṅgha, or they stay in the borderlands.
ai-an2:39.1.6_0: This is for the hurt and unhappiness of the people, for the harm, hurt, and suffering of many people, of gods and humans.
ai-an2:39.2.1_0: At a time when kings are strong, bandits are weak.
ai-an2:39.2.2_0: Then the king is at ease when going out or coming back or when inspecting the provinces.
ai-an2:39.2.3_0: The brahmins and householders, likewise, are at ease when going out or coming back, or when inspecting their business activities.
ai-an2:39.2.4_0: In the same way, at a time when good-hearted mendicants are strong, bad mendicants are weak.
ai-an2:39.2.5_0: Then the bad mendicants continually adhere to silence in the midst of the Saṅgha, or they leave for some place or other.
ai-an2:39.2.6_0: This is for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.”
ai-an2:40.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I don’t praise wrong practice for these two, for laypeople and renunciates.
ai-an2:40.1.2_0: Because of wrong practice, neither laypeople nor renunciates succeed in completing the procedure of the skillful teaching.
ai-an2:40.2.1_0: I praise right practice for these two, for laypeople and renunciates.
ai-an2:40.2.2_0: Because of right practice, both laypeople and renunciates succeed in the procedure of the skillful teaching.”
ai-an2:41.1.1_0: “Mendicants, those mendicants who explain in line with the teaching are acting for the hurt and unhappiness of the people, for the harm, hurt, and suffering of gods and humans.
ai-an2:41.1.2_0: Those mendicants make much bad karma and make the true teaching disappear.
ai-an2:41.2.1_0: Those mendicants who explain in accordance with the Teaching are acting for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.
ai-an2:41.2.2_0: They make much merit and make the true teaching continue.”
ai-an2:41.2.3_0: The fourth sub-chapter on discerning mind is finished.
ai-an2:42.1.3_0: A shallow assembly and a deep assembly.
ai-an2:42.1.4_0: And what is a shallow assembly?
ai-an2:42.1.5_0: An assembly where the mendicants are restless, insolent, fickle, scurrilous, loose-tongued, unmindful, lacking situational awareness and immersion, with straying minds and undisciplined faculties.
ai-an2:42.1.6_0: This is called a shallow assembly.
ai-an2:42.2.1_0: And what is a deep assembly?
ai-an2:42.2.2_0: An assembly where the mendicants are not restless, insolent, fickle, scurrilous, or loose-tongued, but have established mindfulness, situational awareness, immersion, unified minds, and restrained faculties.
ai-an2:42.2.3_0: This is called a deep assembly.
ai-an2:42.2.5_0: The better of these two assemblies is the deep assembly.”
ai-an2:43.1.3_0: A divided assembly and a harmonious assembly.
ai-an2:43.1.4_0: And what is a divided assembly?
ai-an2:43.1.5_0: An assembly where the mendicants argue, quarrel, and fight, continually wounding each other with barbed words.
ai-an2:43.1.6_0: This is called a divided assembly.
ai-an2:43.2.1_0: And what is a harmonious assembly?
ai-an2:43.2.2_0: An assembly where the mendicants live in harmony, appreciating each other, without quarreling, blending like milk and water, and regarding each other with kindly eyes.
ai-an2:43.2.3_0: This is called a harmonious assembly.
ai-an2:43.2.5_0: The better of these two assemblies is the harmonious assembly.”
ai-an2:44.1.3_0: An assembly of the worst and an assembly of the best.
ai-an2:44.1.4_0: And what is an assembly of the worst?
ai-an2:44.1.5_0: An assembly where the senior mendicants are indulgent and slack, leaders in backsliding, neglecting seclusion, not rousing energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized.
ai-an2:44.1.6_0: Those who come after follow their example.
ai-an2:44.1.7_0: They too are indulgent and slack ...
ai-an2:44.1.8_0: This is called an assembly of the worst.
ai-an2:44.2.1_0: And what is an assembly of the best?
ai-an2:44.2.2_0: An assembly where the senior mendicants are not indulgent or slack, nor are they backsliders. Instead, they take the lead in seclusion, rousing energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized.
ai-an2:44.2.3_0: Those who come after follow their example.
ai-an2:44.2.4_0: They too aren’t indulgent or slack ...
ai-an2:44.2.5_0: This is called an assembly of the best.
ai-an2:44.2.7_0: The better of these two assemblies is the assembly of the best.”
ai-an2:45.1.3_0: An ignoble assembly and a noble assembly.
ai-an2:45.1.4_0: And what is an ignoble assembly?
ai-an2:45.1.5_0: An assembly where the mendicants don’t truly understand: ‘This is suffering’ ... ‘This is the origin of suffering’ ... ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ ... ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
ai-an2:45.1.6_0: This is called an ignoble assembly.
ai-an2:45.2.1_0: And what is a noble assembly?
ai-an2:45.2.2_0: An assembly where the mendicants truly understand: ‘This is suffering’ ... ‘This is the origin of suffering’ ... ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ ... ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
ai-an2:45.2.3_0: This is called a noble assembly.
ai-an2:45.2.5_0: The better of these two assemblies is the noble assembly.”
ai-an2:46.1.4_0: And what is an assembly of the dregs?
ai-an2:46.1.5_0: An assembly where the mendicants make decisions unprejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice.
ai-an2:46.1.6_0: This is called an assembly of the dregs.
ai-an2:46.2.1_0: And what is an assembly of the cream?
ai-an2:46.2.2_0: An assembly where the mendicants make decisions unprejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice.
ai-an2:46.2.3_0: This is called an assembly of the cream.
ai-an2:46.2.5_0: The better of these two assemblies is the assembly of the cream.”
ai-an2:47.1.3_0: An assembly educated in fancy talk, not in questioning, and an assembly educated in questioning, not in fancy talk.
ai-an2:47.1.4_0: And what is an assembly educated in fancy talk, not in questioning?
ai-an2:47.1.5_0: It is an assembly where, when discourses spoken by the Realized One—deep, profound, transcendent, dealing with emptiness—are being recited the mendicants do not want to listen. They don’t pay attention or apply their minds to understand them, nor do they think those teachings are worth learning and memorizing.
ai-an2:47.1.6_0: But when discourses composed by poets—poetry, with fancy words and phrases, composed by outsiders or spoken by disciples—are being recited the mendicants do want to listen. They pay attention and apply their minds to understand them, and they think those teachings are worth learning and memorizing. But when they’ve learned those teachings they don’t question or examine each other, saying:
ai-an2:47.1.7_0: ‘Why does it say this? What does that mean?’
ai-an2:47.1.8_0: So they don’t clarify what is unclear, reveal what is obscure, and dispel doubt regarding the many doubtful matters.
ai-an2:47.1.9_0: This is called an assembly educated in fancy talk, not in questioning.
ai-an2:47.2.1_0: And what is an assembly educated in questioning, not in fancy talk?
ai-an2:47.2.2_0: It is an assembly where, when discourses composed by poets—poetry, with fancy words and phrases, composed by outsiders or spoken by disciples—are being recited the mendicants do not want to listen. They don’t pay attention or apply their minds to understand them, nor do they think those teachings are worth learning and memorizing.
ai-an2:47.2.3_0: But when discourses spoken by the Realized One—deep, profound, transcendent, dealing with emptiness—are being recited they want to listen. They pay attention and apply their minds to understand them, and they think those teachings are worth learning and memorizing.
ai-an2:47.2.4_0: And when they’ve learned those teachings they question and examine each other, saying:
ai-an2:47.2.5_0: ‘Why does it say this? What does that mean?’
ai-an2:47.2.6_0: So they clarify what is unclear, reveal what is obscure, and dispel doubt regarding the many doubtful matters.
ai-an2:47.2.7_0: This is called an assembly educated in questioning, not in fancy talk.
ai-an2:47.2.9_0: The better of these two assemblies is the assembly educated in questioning, not in fancy talk.”
ai-an2:48.1.3_0: An assembly that values material things, not the true teaching, and an assembly that values the true teaching, not material things.
ai-an2:48.1.4_0: And what is an assembly that values material things, not the true teaching?
ai-an2:48.1.5_0: It is an assembly where the mendicants praise each other in front of the white-clothed laypeople, saying:
ai-an2:48.1.6_0: ‘The mendicant so-and-so is freed both ways; so-and-so is freed by wisdom; so-and-so is a personal witness; so-and-so is attained to view; so-and-so is freed by faith; so-and-so is a follower of the teachings; so-and-so is a follower by faith; so-and-so is ethical, of good character; so-and-so is unethical, of bad character.’
ai-an2:48.1.7_0: In this way they get material things.
ai-an2:48.1.8_0: And when they get these things, they use them tied, infatuated, attached, blind to the drawbacks, and not understanding the escape.
ai-an2:48.1.9_0: This is called an assembly that values material things, not the true teaching.
ai-an2:48.2.1_0: And what is an assembly that values the true teaching, not material things?
ai-an2:48.2.2_0: It is an assembly where the mendicants don’t praise each other in front of the white-clothed laypeople, saying:
ai-an2:48.2.3_0: ‘The mendicant so-and-so is freed both ways; so-and-so is freed by wisdom; so-and-so is a personal witness; so-and-so is attained to view; so-and-so is freed by faith; so-and-so is a follower of the teachings; so-and-so is a follower by faith; so-and-so is ethical, of good character; so-and-so is unethical, of bad character.’
ai-an2:48.2.4_0: In this way they get material things.
ai-an2:48.2.5_0: And when they get these things, they use them untied, uninfatuated, unattached, seeing the drawbacks, and understanding the escape.
ai-an2:48.2.6_0: This is called an assembly that values the true teaching, not material things.
ai-an2:48.2.8_0: The better of these two assemblies is the assembly that values the true teaching, not material things.”
ai-an2:49.1.3_0: An unjust assembly and a just assembly.
ai-an2:49.1.4_0: And what is an unjust assembly?
ai-an2:49.1.5_0: An assembly where legal acts in line with the teaching proceed, while legal acts against the teaching don’t proceed. Legal acts in line with the training proceed, while legal acts against the training don’t proceed. Legal acts in line with the teaching are explained, while legal acts against the teaching aren’t explained. Legal acts in line with the training are explained, while legal acts against the training aren’t explained.
ai-an2:49.1.6_0: This is called an unjust assembly.
ai-an2:49.2.1_0: And what is a just assembly?
ai-an2:49.2.2_0: An assembly where legal acts in line with the teaching proceed, while legal acts against the teaching don’t proceed. Legal acts in line with the training proceed, while legal acts against the training don’t proceed. Legal acts in line with the teaching are explained, while legal acts against the teaching aren’t explained. Legal acts in line with the training are explained, while legal acts against the training aren’t explained.
ai-an2:49.2.3_0: This is called a just assembly.
ai-an2:49.2.5_0: The better of these two assemblies is the assembly.”
ai-an2:50.1.3_0: An assembly with unprincipled assembly and two assemblies.
ai-an2:50.1.4_0: The better of these two assemblies is the principled assembly.”
ai-an2:51.1.3_0: An assembly with unprincipled speech, and an assembly with principled speech.
ai-an2:51.1.4_0: And what is an assembly with unprincipled speech?
ai-an2:51.1.5_0: It is an assembly where the mendicants take up disciplinary issues, whether legitimate or not.
ai-an2:51.1.6_0: But they don’t persuade each other or allow themselves to be persuaded, nor do they convince each other or allow themselves to be convinced.
ai-an2:51.1.7_0: Since they are able to persuade and convince each other, they let go of their opinions. They obstinately stick to that disciplinary issue or insist that:
ai-an2:51.1.8_0: ‘This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.’
ai-an2:51.1.9_0: This is called an assembly with unprincipled speech.
ai-an2:51.2.1_0: And what is an assembly with principled speech?
ai-an2:51.2.2_0: It is an assembly where the mendicants take up disciplinary issues, whether legitimate or not.
ai-an2:51.2.3_0: But they persuade each other and everyone by each other or allow them to be persuaded, saying:
ai-an2:51.2.4_0: Since they are able to persuade and convince each other, they let go of their opinions. They don’t obstinately stick to that disciplinary issue or insist that:
ai-an2:51.2.5_0: ‘This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.’
ai-an2:51.2.6_0: This is called an assembly with principled speech.
ai-an2:51.2.8_0: The better of these two assemblies is the assembly with principled speech.”
ai-an2:51.2.9_0: The fifth sub-chapter on probation is finished.
ai-an2:51.3.1_0: The animal realm is said to be the best.
ai-an2:51.3.3_0: but material possessions is included in the world,
ai-an2:52.1.1_0: “Two people, mendicants, arise in the world for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.
ai-an2:52.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:52.1.3_0: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha; and the wheel-turning monarch.
ai-an2:52.1.4_0: These two people arise in the world for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.”
ai-an2:53.1.1_0: “Two people, mendicants, arise in the world who are incredible human beings.
ai-an2:53.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:53.1.3_0: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha; and the wheel-turning monarch.
ai-an2:53.1.4_0: These are the two people who arise in the world who are incredible human beings.”
ai-an2:54.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a person is regretted by many people.
ai-an2:54.1.3_0: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha; and the wheel-turning monarch.
ai-an2:54.1.4_0: These are the two people, mendicants, whose death is regretted by many people.”
ai-an2:55.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these two are worthy of a monument.
ai-an2:55.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:55.1.3_0: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha; and the wheel-turning monarch.
ai-an2:55.1.4_0: These are the two who are worthy of a monument.”
ai-an2:56.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these two kinds of Buddhas.
ai-an2:56.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:56.1.3_0: The Realised One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha,
ai-an2:56.1.4_0: These are the two kinds of Buddhas.”
ai-an2:57.1.1_0: “These two, mendicants, are not startled by a crack of thunder.
ai-an2:57.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:57.1.3_0: A mendicant who has ended defilements; and a thoroughbred elephant.
ai-an2:57.1.4_0: These are the two who are not startled by a crack of thunder.”
ai-an2:58.1.1_0: “These two, mendicants, are not startled by a crack of thunder.
ai-an2:58.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:58.1.3_0: A mendicant who has ended defilements; and a thoroughbred horse.
ai-an2:58.1.4_0: These are the two who are not startled by a crack of thunder.”
ai-an2:59.1.1_0: “These two, mendicants, are not startled by a crack of thunder.
ai-an2:59.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:59.1.3_0: A mendicant who has ended defilements; and a lion, king of beasts.
ai-an2:59.1.4_0: These are the two who are not startled by a crack of thunder.”
ai-an2:60.1.1_0: “Fauns see two reasons not to use human speech.
ai-an2:60.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:60.1.3_0: They don’t misrepresent me with what is false, and untrue.
ai-an2:60.1.4_0: Fauns see two reasons not to use human speech.”
ai-an2:61.1.1_0: “Mendicants, females die without getting enough of two things.
ai-an2:61.1.4_0: Females die without getting enough of these two things.”
ai-an2:62.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I will teach you about living with bad people and living with good people.
ai-an2:62.1.2_0: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-an2:62.2.1_0: “What is it like living with bad people? How do bad people live together?
ai-an2:62.2.2_0: It’s when a senior mendicant thinks:
ai-an2:62.2.3_0: ‘No mendicant, whether senior, middle, or junior, should admonish me;
ai-an2:62.2.4_0: and I’ll admonish any mendicant, whether senior, middle, or junior.
ai-an2:62.2.5_0: If a mendicant—whether senior, middle, or junior—were to admonish me, they wouldn’t be sympathetic, and I’d bother them by saying “No!” And anyway I wouldn’t deal with it even if I saw what I did wrong.’
ai-an2:62.2.6_1: If they couldn’t admonish me, they’d be sympathetic, and I’d bother them by saying “No!” And anyway I wouldn’t deal with it even if I saw what I did wrong.’
ai-an2:62.2.7_0: And a middle or a junior mendicant also thinks:
ai-an2:62.2.8_0: ‘No mendicant, whether senior, middle, or junior, should admonish me;
ai-an2:62.2.9_0: and I’ll admonish any mendicant, whether senior, middle, or junior.
ai-an2:62.2.10_0: If a mendicant—whether senior, middle, or junior—were to admonish me, they wouldn’t be sympathetic, and I’d bother them by saying “No!” And anyway I wouldn’t deal with it even if I saw what I did wrong.’
ai-an2:62.2.11_1: If they couldn’t admonish me, they’d be sympathetic, and I’d bother them by saying “No!” And anyway I wouldn’t deal with it even if I saw what I did wrong.’
ai-an2:62.2.12_0: That’s what it’s like living with bad people; that’s how bad people live together.
ai-an2:62.3.1_0: What is it like living with good people? How do good people live together?
ai-an2:62.3.2_0: It’s when a senior mendicant thinks:
ai-an2:62.3.3_0: ‘Any mendicant, whether senior, middle, or junior, should admonish me;
ai-an2:62.3.4_0: and I’ll admonish any mendicant, whether senior, middle, or junior.
ai-an2:62.3.5_0: If a mendicant—whether senior, middle, or junior—were to admonish me, they’d be sympathetic, so I wouldn’t bother them, but say “Thank you!” And I’d deal with it when I saw what I did wrong.’
ai-an2:62.3.6_1: If they couldn’t say anything left over, I’d bother them, not sympathetic, so I wouldn’t bother them.’
ai-an2:62.3.7_0: And a middle or a junior mendicant also thinks:
ai-an2:62.3.8_0: ‘Any mendicant, whether senior, middle, or junior, should admonish me;
ai-an2:62.3.9_0: and I’ll admonish any mendicant, whether senior, middle, or junior.
ai-an2:62.3.10_0: If a mendicant—whether senior, middle, or junior—were to admonish me, they’d be sympathetic, so I wouldn’t bother them, but say “Thank you!” And I’d deal with it when I saw what I did wrong.’
ai-an2:62.3.11_1: If they couldn’t say anything left over, I’d bother them, not sympathetic, so I wouldn’t bother them.’
ai-an2:62.3.12_0: That’s what it’s like living with good people; that’s how good people live together.”
ai-an2:63.1.1_0: “In a disciplinary issue, when the tale-bearing on both sides—with contempt for each other’s views, resentful, bitter, and exasperated—is not settled internally, you can expect that this disciplinary issue will be
ai-an2:63.1.2_0: long, fractious, and troublesome, and the mendicants won’t live comfortably.
ai-an2:63.2.2_0: won’t lead to lasting acrimony and enmity, and the mendicants will live comfortably.”
ai-an2:63.2.3_0: The first sub-chapter on bad people is finished.
ai-an2:64.1.1_0: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.
ai-an2:64.1.3_0: The happiness of laypeople, and the happiness of renunciates.
ai-an2:64.1.4_0: These are the two kinds of happiness.
ai-an2:64.1.5_0: The better of these two kinds of happiness is the happiness of renunciates.”
ai-an2:65.1.1_0: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.
ai-an2:65.1.4_0: These are the two kinds of happiness.
ai-an2:65.1.5_0: The better of these two kinds of happiness is the happiness of renunciation.”
ai-an2:66.1.1_0: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.
ai-an2:66.1.3_0: The happiness of attachments, and the happiness of no attachments.
ai-an2:66.1.4_0: These are the two kinds of happiness.
ai-an2:66.1.5_0: The better of these two kinds of happiness is the happiness of no attachments.”
ai-an2:67.1.1_0: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.
ai-an2:67.1.4_0: These are the two kinds of happiness.
ai-an2:67.1.5_0: The better of these two kinds of happiness is the happiness of no defilements.”
ai-an2:68.1.1_0: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.
ai-an2:68.1.4_0: These are the two kinds of happiness.
ai-an2:68.1.5_0: The better of these two kinds of happiness is spiritual happiness.”
ai-an2:69.1.1_0: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.
ai-an2:69.1.4_0: These are the two kinds of happiness.
ai-an2:69.1.5_0: The better of these two kinds of happiness is noble happiness.”
ai-an2:70.1.1_0: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.
ai-an2:70.1.4_0: These are the two kinds of happiness.
ai-an2:70.1.5_0: The better of these two kinds of happiness is mental happiness.”
ai-an2:71.1.1_0: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.
ai-an2:71.1.3_0: Happiness with rapture and happiness free of rapture.
ai-an2:71.1.4_0: These are the two kinds of happiness.
ai-an2:71.1.5_0: The better of these two kinds of happiness is happiness free of rapture.”
ai-an2:72.1.1_0: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.
ai-an2:72.1.4_0: These are the two kinds of happiness.
ai-an2:72.1.5_0: The better of these two kinds of happiness is the happiness of equanimity.”
ai-an2:73.1.1_0: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.
ai-an2:73.1.3_0: The happiness of immersion and the happiness without immersion.
ai-an2:73.1.4_0: These are the two kinds of happiness.
ai-an2:73.1.5_0: The better of these two kinds of happiness is the happiness of immersion.”
ai-an2:74.1.1_0: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.
ai-an2:74.1.3_0: Happiness with rapture and happiness free from rapture.
ai-an2:74.1.4_0: These are the two kinds of happiness.
ai-an2:74.1.5_0: The better of these two kinds of happiness is happiness free of rapture.”
ai-an2:75.1.1_0: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.
ai-an2:75.1.3_0: Happiness that relies on pleasure and happiness that relies on equanimity.
ai-an2:75.1.4_0: These are the two kinds of happiness.
ai-an2:75.1.5_0: The better of these two kinds of happiness is the happiness of equanimity.”
ai-an2:76.1.1_0: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.
ai-an2:76.1.3_0: Happiness that relies on form and happiness that relies on the formless.
ai-an2:76.1.4_0: These are the two kinds of happiness.
ai-an2:76.1.5_0: The better of these two kinds of happiness is happiness that relies on the formless.”
ai-an2:77.1.1_0: “Bad, unskillful qualities, mendicants, arise with a foundation, not without sign.
ai-an2:77.1.2_0: By giving up that foundation, those bad, unskillful qualities do not occur.”
ai-an2:78.1.1_0: “Bad, unskillful qualities, mendicants, arise with a source, not without a source.
ai-an2:78.1.2_0: By giving up that source, those bad, unskillful qualities do not occur.”
ai-an2:79.1.1_0: “Bad, unskillful qualities, mendicants, arise with a cause, not without a cause.
ai-an2:79.1.2_0: By giving up that cause, those bad, unskillful qualities do not occur.”
ai-an2:80.1.1_0: “Bad, unskillful qualities, mendicants, arise with conditions, not without conditions.
ai-an2:80.1.2_0: By giving up those conditions, those bad, unskillful qualities do not occur.”
ai-an2:81.1.1_0: “Bad, unskillful qualities, mendicants, arise with a reason, not without a reason.
ai-an2:81.1.2_0: By giving up that reason, those bad, unskillful qualities do not occur.”
ai-an2:82.1.1_0: “Bad, unskillful qualities, mendicants, arise with form, not without form.
ai-an2:82.1.2_0: By giving up that form, those bad, unskillful qualities do not occur.”
ai-an2:83.1.1_0: “Bad, unskillful qualities, mendicants, arise with feeling, not without feeling.
ai-an2:83.1.2_0: By giving up that feeling, those bad, unskillful qualities do not occur.”
ai-an2:84.1.1_0: “Bad, unskillful qualities, mendicants, arise with perception, not without perception.
ai-an2:84.1.2_0: By giving up that perception, those bad, unskillful qualities do not occur.”
ai-an2:85.1.1_0: “Bad, unskillful qualities, mendicants, arise with consciousness, not without consciousness.
ai-an2:85.1.2_0: By giving up that consciousness, those bad, unskillful qualities do not occur.”
ai-an2:86.1.1_0: “Bad, unskillful qualities, mendicants, arise with a conditioned object, not without a support.
ai-an2:86.1.2_0: By giving up that conditioned basis, those bad, unskillful qualities do not occur.”
ai-an2:86.1.3_0: The third sub-chapter on signs is finished.
ai-an2:87.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:87.1.3_0: Freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom.
ai-an2:88.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:89.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:90.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:91.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:91.1.3_0: Views favoring continued existence and views favoring ending existence.
ai-an2:92.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:93.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:94.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:94.1.3_0: Being hard to admonish and having bad friends.
ai-an2:95.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:95.1.3_0: Being easy to admonish and having good friends,
ai-an2:96.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:96.1.3_0: Skill in the elements and skill in attention.
ai-an2:97.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:97.1.3_0: Skill in offenses and skill in rehabilitation from offenses.
ai-an2:97.1.5_0: The fourth sub-chapter on teaching is finished.
ai-an2:98.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:98.1.3_0: One who takes responsibility for what has not come to pass, and one who doesn’t take responsibility for what has come to pass.
ai-an2:99.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:99.1.3_0: One who doesn’t take responsibility for what has not come to pass, and one who does take responsibility for what has come to pass.
ai-an2:99.1.4_0: These are the two who are astute.”
ai-an2:100.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:100.1.3_0: One who perceives what is not allowable, and one who perceives what is not allowable,
ai-an2:101.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:101.1.3_0: One who perceives what is not allowable and what is not.
ai-an2:101.1.4_0: These are the two who are astute.”
ai-an2:102.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:102.1.3_0: One who perceives a non-offense as an offense, and one who perceives an offense as a non-offense.
ai-an2:103.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:103.1.3_0: One who perceives a non-offense as a non-offense, and one who perceives an offense as an offense.
ai-an2:103.1.4_0: These are the two who are astute.”
ai-an2:104.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:104.1.3_0: One who perceives what is not the teaching as the teaching, and one who perceives the teaching as not the teaching.
ai-an2:105.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:105.1.3_0: One who perceives the teaching as the teaching, and one who perceives what is not the teaching as not the teaching.
ai-an2:105.1.4_0: These are the two who are astute.”
ai-an2:106.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:106.1.3_0: One who perceives what is not the training as not the training, and one who perceives what is the training as not the training.
ai-an2:107.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:107.1.3_0: One who perceives what is not the training as not the training, and one who perceives what is the training as not the training.
ai-an2:107.1.4_0: These are the two who are astute.”
ai-an2:108.1.3_0: One who is remorseful over something they shouldn’t be, and one who isn’t remorseful over something they should be.
ai-an2:108.1.4_0: These are the two whose defilements grow.”
ai-an2:109.1.3_0: One who is remorseful over something they shouldn’t be, and one who isn’t remorseful over something they should be.
ai-an2:109.1.4_0: These are the two whose defilements don’t grow.”
ai-an2:110.1.3_0: One who perceives what is not allowable, and one who perceives what is not allowable,
ai-an2:110.1.4_0: These are the two whose defilements grow.”
ai-an2:111.1.3_0: One who perceives what is not allowable and what is not.
ai-an2:111.1.4_0: These are the two whose defilements don’t grow.”
ai-an2:112.1.3_0: One who perceives an offense as a non-offense, and one who perceives a non-offense as an offense.
ai-an2:112.1.4_0: These are the two whose defilements grow.”
ai-an2:113.1.3_0: One who perceives an offense as an offense, and one who perceives a non-offense as a non-offense.
ai-an2:113.1.4_0: These are the two whose defilements don’t grow.”
ai-an2:114.1.3_0: One who perceives what is not the teaching as the teaching, and one who perceives the teaching as not the teaching.
ai-an2:114.1.4_0: These are the two whose defilements grow.”
ai-an2:115.1.3_0: One who perceives the teaching as the teaching, and one who perceives what is not the teaching as not the teaching.
ai-an2:115.1.4_0: These are the two whose defilements don’t grow.”
ai-an2:116.1.3_0: One who perceives what is not the training as not the training, and one who perceives what is the training as not the training.
ai-an2:116.1.4_0: These are the two whose defilements grow.”
ai-an2:117.1.3_0: One who perceives what is not the training as not the training, and one who perceives what is the training as not the training.
ai-an2:117.1.4_0: These are the two whose defilements don’t grow.”
ai-an2:117.1.5_0: The fifth sub-chapter on fools is finished.
ai-an2:117.1.6_0: The second rains residence was completed.
ai-an2:118.1.1_0: “These two hopes are hard to give up.
ai-an2:118.1.3_0: The hope for wealth and the hope for long life.
ai-an2:118.1.4_0: These are the two kinds of give up.”
ai-an2:119.1.1_0: “These two people are rare in the world.
ai-an2:119.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:119.1.3_0: One who understands what is grateful and thankful,
ai-an2:119.1.4_0: These are the two people who are rare in the world.”
ai-an2:120.1.1_0: “These two people are rare in the world.
ai-an2:120.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:120.1.3_0: One who is satisfied, and one who satisfies others.
ai-an2:120.1.4_0: These are the two people who are rare in the world.”
ai-an2:121.1.1_0: “These two people are hard to satisfy in the world.
ai-an2:121.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:121.1.3_0: One who continually hoards wealth, and one who continually wastes wealth.
ai-an2:121.1.4_0: These are the two people who are hard to satisfy in the world.”
ai-an2:122.1.1_0: “These two people are easy to satisfy in the world.
ai-an2:122.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:122.1.3_0: One who continually hoards wealth, and one who continually wastes wealth.
ai-an2:122.1.4_0: These are the two people easy to satisfy in the world.”
ai-an2:123.1.1_0: “There are two conditions for the arising of greed.
ai-an2:123.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:123.1.3_0: The feature of beauty and improper attention.
ai-an2:123.1.4_0: These are the two conditions for the arising of greed.”
ai-an2:124.1.1_0: “There are two conditions for the arising of hate.
ai-an2:124.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:124.1.3_0: The feature of harshness and improper attention.
ai-an2:124.1.4_0: These are the two conditions for the arising of hate.”
ai-an2:125.1.1_0: “There are two conditions for the arising of wrong view.
ai-an2:125.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:125.1.3_0: The words of another and improper attention.
ai-an2:125.1.4_0: These are the two conditions for the arising of wrong view.”
ai-an2:126.1.1_0: “There are two conditions for the arising of right view.
ai-an2:126.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:126.1.3_0: the words of another and proper attention.
ai-an2:126.1.4_0: These are the two conditions for the arising of right view.”

ai-an2:129.1.3_0: An offense requiring rehabilitation and an offense not requiring rehabilitation.

ai-an2:130.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a faithful monk would rightly aspire:
ai-an2:130.1.2_0: ‘May I be like Sāriputta and Moggallāna!’
ai-an2:130.1.3_0: These are a standard and a measure for my monk disciples, that is, Sāriputta and Moggallāna.”
ai-an2:131.1.2_0: ‘May I be like the nuns Khemā and Uppalavaṇṇā!’
ai-an2:131.1.3_0: These are a standard and a measure for my nun disciples, that is, the nuns Khemā and Uppalavaṇṇā.”
ai-an2:132.1.2_0: ‘May I be like the householder Citta and Hatthaka of Aḷavī!’
ai-an2:132.1.3_0: These are a standard and a measure for my male lay followers, that is, the householder Citta and Hatthaka of Aḷavī.”
ai-an2:133.1.2_0: ‘May I be like the laywomen Khujjuttarā and Veḷukaṇṭakī, Nanda’s mother!’
ai-an2:133.1.3_0: These are a standard and a measure for my female lay disciples, that is, the laywomen Khujjuttarā and Veḷukaṇṭakī, Nanda’s mother.”
ai-an2:134.1.1_0: “When a foolish, incompetent bad person has two qualities they keep themselves broken and damaged. They deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they make much bad karma.
ai-an2:134.1.3_0: Without examining or scrutinizing, they praise those deserving of criticism
ai-an2:134.1.4_0: and criticizes those deserving of praise.
ai-an2:134.1.5_0: When a foolish, incompetent bad person has these two qualities they keep themselves broken and damaged. They deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they make much bad karma.
ai-an2:134.2.1_0: When an astute, competent good person has two qualities they keep themselves healthy and whole. They don’t deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they make much merit.
ai-an2:134.2.3_0: After examining and scrutinizing, they criticize those deserving of criticism
ai-an2:134.2.4_0: and praises those deserving of praise.
ai-an2:134.2.5_0: When an astute, competent good person has these two qualities they keep themselves healthy and whole. They don’t deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they make much merit.”
ai-an2:135.1.1_0: “When a foolish, incompetent bad person has two qualities they keep themselves broken and damaged. They deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they make much bad karma.
ai-an2:135.1.3_0: She arouses faith in things that are dubious,
ai-an2:135.1.4_0: and doesn’t arouse faith in things that are inspiring.
ai-an2:135.1.5_0: When a foolish, incompetent bad person has these two qualities they keep themselves broken and damaged. They deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they make much bad karma.
ai-an2:135.2.1_0: When an astute, competent good person has two qualities they keep themselves healthy and whole. They don’t deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they make much merit.
ai-an2:135.2.3_0: She doesn’t arouse faith in things that are dubious,
ai-an2:135.2.4_0: and does arouse faith in things that are inspiring.
ai-an2:135.2.5_0: When an astute, competent good person has these two qualities they keep themselves healthy and whole. They don’t deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they make much merit.”
ai-an2:136.1.1_0: “When a foolish, incompetent bad person acts wrongly toward two people they keep themselves broken and damaged. They deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they make much bad karma.
ai-an2:136.1.4_0: When a foolish, incompetent bad person acts wrongly toward these two people they keep themselves broken and damaged. They deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they make much bad karma.
ai-an2:136.2.1_0: When an astute, competent good person acts rightly toward two people they keep themselves healthy and whole. They don’t deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they make much merit.
ai-an2:136.2.4_0: When an astute, competent good person acts rightly toward these two people they keep themselves healthy and whole. They don’t deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they make much merit.”
ai-an2:137.1.1_0: “When a foolish, incompetent bad person acts wrongly toward two people they keep themselves broken and damaged. They deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they make much bad karma.
ai-an2:137.1.3_0: The Realized One and a disciple of the Realized One.
ai-an2:137.1.4_0: When a foolish, incompetent bad person acts wrongly toward these people they keep themselves broken and damaged. They deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they make much bad karma.
ai-an2:137.2.1_0: When an astute, competent good person acts rightly toward two people they keep themselves healthy and whole. They don’t deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they make much merit.
ai-an2:137.2.3_0: The Realized One and a disciple of the Realized One.
ai-an2:137.2.4_0: When an astute, competent good person acts rightly toward these two people they keep themselves healthy and whole. They don’t deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they make much merit.”

ai-an2:142.1.3_0: An offering of material things and an offering of the teaching.
ai-an2:142.1.5_0: The better of these two offerings is an offering of the teaching.”

ai-an2:143.1.3_0: Generosity with material things and generosity with the teaching.
ai-an2:143.1.4_0: These are the two acts of generosity.
ai-an2:143.1.5_0: The better of these two acts of generosity is generosity with the teaching.”

ai-an2:144.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:144.1.3_0: Charity in material things and charity in the teaching.
ai-an2:144.1.4_0: These are the two kinds of charity.
ai-an2:144.1.5_0: The better of these two kinds of charity is charity in the teaching.”
ai-an2:145.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:145.1.3_0: Riches in material things and riches in the teaching.
ai-an2:145.1.5_0: The better of these two riches is riches in the teaching.”
ai-an2:146.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:146.1.3_0: material living together and spiritual living together.
ai-an2:146.1.5_0: The better of these two kinds of enjoyment is the enjoyment of the teaching.”
ai-an2:147.1.1_0: “There are these two kinds of sharing.
ai-an2:147.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:147.1.3_0: Seclusion in material things and sharing the teaching.
ai-an2:147.1.4_0: These are the two kinds of sharing.
ai-an2:147.1.5_0: The better of these two kinds of sharing is sharing the teaching.”
ai-an2:148.1.1_0: “There are these two kinds of inclusion.
ai-an2:148.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:148.1.3_0: Inclusion in material things and inclusion in the teaching.
ai-an2:148.1.4_0: These are the two kinds of inclusion.
ai-an2:148.1.5_0: The better of these two kinds of inclusion is inclusion in the teaching.”
ai-an2:149.1.1_0: “There are these two kinds of support.
ai-an2:149.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-an2:149.1.3_0: Support in material things and support in the teaching.
ai-an2:149.1.4_0: These are the two kinds of support.
ai-an2:149.1.5_0: The better of these two kinds of support is support in the teaching.”
ai-an2:150.1.1_0: “There are these two kinds of sympathy.
ai-an2:150.1.3_0: Sympathy in material things and sympathy in the teaching.
ai-an2:150.1.4_0: These are the two kinds of sympathy.
ai-an2:150.1.5_0: The better of these two kinds of sympathy is sympathy in the teaching.”
